references.reason: This paper is foundational as it describes the GPT-4 model, which is a central component of the SAFE-SQL framework.

references.paper_title: Din-SQL: Decomposed in-context learning of text-to-SQL with self-correction
references.reason: This paper is highly relevant as it introduces a method for self-correction in text-to-SQL, an important aspect of SAFE-SQL's approach to improving accuracy.

references.paper_title: Enhancing LLMs fine-tuning for text-to-SQLs by SQL quality measurement
references.reason: This work directly addresses the issue of improving the quality of generated SQL, a key focus of SAFE-SQL.

references.paper_title: Select-SQL: Self-correcting ensemble chain-of-thought for text-to-SQL
references.reason: This paper presents a related technique that uses chain-of-thought prompting and self-correction to improve text-to-SQL performance, similar to SAFE-SQL's strategy.

references.paper_title: Spider: A large-scale human-labeled dataset for complex and cross-domain semantic parsing and text-to-SQL task
references.reason: This paper introduces the Spider dataset, a widely used benchmark for evaluating text-to-SQL models, which is used in the evaluation of SAFE-SQL.
